item.description:
11/05/2012: THIS EVENT IS NOW FULL - IF YOU HAVE NOT ALREADY REGISTERED WITH THE AMC YOU WON"T BE ABLE TO GO.

=====

If you plan to begin winter hiking or need to brush up on your skills I would strongly recommend the Winter Hiking and Backpacking Program being offered by the Boston Chapter of the AMC. I participated in this program years ago and still find myself referring back to the information that I learned. We will be coordinating some of our own introductory trips so be sure to watch for the trip postings.

=====

This course teaches winter hiking and backpacking. Taught by Boston Chapter AMC leaders, students will have lectures, small group breakout sessions, and hands-on opportunities with winter gear. Topics include heat management and clothing, group hiking techniques, energy management and nutrition, winter travel and snowshoeing, winter safety and injury prevention, above tree-line hiking, non-technical use of ice axe and crampons, weather, camping techniques, equipment, food prep and more.

There will be weekend trips throughout the winter offered exclusively or preferentially to participants in this class so you can put your learning in practice. Plus, this is a great opportunity to meet lots of other people who love the outdoors, and to make new friends.

=====

The program runs on five nights from 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM.

  • November 7
  • November 13
  • November 27
  • December 4
  • December 11

=====

The program takes place at AMC Cabot Auditorium located at 4 Joy Street in Boston, MA. It's near the Park Street T Station, the Massachusetts State House and the Boston Common. Discount parking passes are available for the Boston Common Garage.

The program costs $55 for AMC members/$60 non-members w/advance registration (before November 1). At-the-door registration is $60 AMC members/$65 non-members. The registration fee includes a printed Winter Hiking manual.

You must register online at https://hbbostonamc.org/regi/332 to participate.

=====

Contact the program organizer if you have general questions.

  • Fred Smith at fredsmithhikes@gmail.com

With questions about registration, Contact the registrar with any registration questions.

  • Chris McCarron at chrishbamc@gmail.com
item.name: AMC Boston's Introduction to Winter Hiking and Backpacking - Class 1 of 5
